channel.title: [Game] LawGame Beta 1.0 [Text-Game]
channel.description:
Well, I hope you guys like text games, because that's what LawGame is. Also, you sort of have to be a fast reader since I use the report box.
There's not much in the game right now, but I'm going to add forms soon so the game will be alot easier. Also with the form I can make shops to buy stuff so the money you make in the game when you win a battle wont be useless. :P
Basic plot: You play as a Lawyer, sorta play, more like read, but that'll be changed soon! And you're against a Judge (will be selectable to be played soon). The object is: you want to beat him as many times as possible. So far the fighting system is completely random, but AGAIN, this all will be changed soon!
Basicaly, the current stage of development that the script is at is more of a base for the game. But you can still have a [size=7pt]tiny[/size] bit of fun with it.
I DO take suggestions for this game and feel free to modify the game and re-post it if you want.
Maybe I should make a version that you play as a hacker and you try to kill Andrew Gower and the rest of the Jagex team? :P
[b]Coming soon:[/b]
[ul][*]Forms for easy playing [*]Item shop [*]Saving system for those players who want to reach Match # 1,000,000[/ul]
P.S. If you're not a fast reader, then you can always just pause the script if you want to read something it sais, then resume it when you want to continue.
Note: The script is attached to this post.
Have fun, ~Dizzy :D

item.title: [Game] LawGame Beta 1.0 [Text-Game]
item.dc:creator: @Dizzy Dizzy
item.description:
@Dizzy wrote:

petrock6:

May i talk a suggestion? Maybe in ‘agility’ you make a cheap version of the gnome agilitycourse, in ms-paint…(cough) and you click them to run over them.

Lol, no thanks. The agility isn’t like the skill in RuneScape. But thanks for the suggestion, it just gave me a new idea. How 'bout when I make the shop, you can buy agility packs and potions.

Agility pack: Depending on the pack, your Agility skill will be raised. (e.g., 1-3 levels)
Agility potion: Depending on the potion, your Agility skill will be raised for one match. Or Super & Mega Agility potions, making it so you get up to 2-3 matches.

XxKanexX: I like your version, but I want the game to be almost endless. I like my fighting system already, all it needs is some tweaks though to fix the problem where the Judge would almost attack you non-stop without the player getting a turn. Which can be easily fixed by giving the Lawyer a higher Agility skill level when the game starts. I can still use your help, so keep those submissions comin’.

Oh and no one needs to worry about having to restart the game after winning like 100 rounds or so, because I’m going to add a little saving system soon.

~Dizzy

Read full topic

item.title: [Game] LawGame Beta 1.0 [Text-Game]
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

It could be made alot simpler.

You can have a look at a version i wrote, if you like. Easiest way to learn. If you have any questions, just ask.

const LawyerName = 'Bob';
const JudgeHealth = 50;
const LawyerHealth = 50;

var Lh, Jh, i: integer;
begin
  Lh := LawyerHealth;
  Jh := JudgeHealth;
  ClearDebug;
  repeat
    i := Random(7) + Random(7) + 1;
    if (Random(100) >= 45 + Random(10)) then
    begin
      Writeln(LawyerName + ' attacks the Judge! (' + inttostr(i) + ' Damage)');
      Jh := Jh - i;
      if (Jh <= 0) then
      begin
        Writeln(' ');
        Writeln(LawyerName + ' wins!');
        Terminatescript;
      end;
      Writeln('Judge now has ' + Inttostr(Jh) + ' health.');
    end else
    begin
      Writeln('Judge attacks ' + LawyerName + '! (' + inttostr(i) + ' Damage)');
      Lh := Lh - i;
      if (Lh <= 0) then
      begin
        Writeln(' ');
        Writeln('Judge wins!');
        Terminatescript;
      end;
      Writeln(LawyerName + ' now has ' + Inttostr(Lh) + ' health.');
    end;
    Writeln(' ');
    Wait(1000);
  until (false);
end.

Read full topic

item.title: [Game] LawGame Beta 1.0 [Text-Game]
item.dc:creator: @Dizzy Dizzy
item.description:
@Dizzy wrote:

Read my reply again, I changed it lol.
But if you REALLY want to win the Judge, then you can modify the script a bit to make your Agility Level really high

Tutorial: How to cheat in the game to attack ALOT:

Go to Line 207 in the script and under

IsNewGame := false;

ADD:

PlayerAgility := 9999;

Ta da, you are now going to own the Judge. Cheater.

End of Tutorial.

Read full topic

item.title: [Game] LawGame Beta 1.0 [Text-Game]
item.dc:creator: @Dizzy Dizzy
item.description:
@Dizzy wrote:

bullzeye:

After awhile the judge just attacks you and you don’t attack back :-/

The Lord and Master Dizzy:

So far the fighting system is completely random, but AGAIN, this all will be changed soon!

Edit: Also, it depends on your Lawyer’s Agility Level on how much he attacks. The higher the agility, the more often you will attack. I think it needs some fixing though…

Read full topic

item.title: [Game] LawGame Beta 1.0 [Text-Game]
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

After awhile the judge just attacks you and you don’t attack back :-/

Judge attacks Lawyer for: 5 damage. Lawyer has 78 health left. Judge attacks Lawyer for: 14 damage. Lawyer has 64 health left. Judge attacks Lawyer for: 15 damage. Lawyer has 49 health left. Judge attacks Lawyer for: 0 damage. Lawyer has 49 health left. Judge attacks Lawyer for: 15 damage. Lawyer has 34 health left. Judge attacks Lawyer for: 5 damage. Lawyer has 29 health left. Lawyer attacks Judge for: 13 damage. Judge has 31 health left. Judge attacks Lawyer for: 7 damage. Lawyer has 22 health left. Judge attacks Lawyer for: 8 damage. Lawyer has 14 health left. Judge attacks Lawyer for: 1 damage. Lawyer has 13 health left. Judge attacks Lawyer for: 6 damage. Lawyer has 7 health left. Judge attacks Lawyer for: 10 damage. Lawyer has -3 health left. Bob has died - YOU LOSE

Read full topic
